stories.title: Ola Finance promised to skip “cumbersome” lending requirements, hacked for $3.6M

stories.text:
So, thats the thing. I will start working on a company who's main technology is .NET (C# with WPF).

My background is Java and Javascript, so I bet I won't have to trouble to get hands on with C# itself, but I'm asking if somebody was in this situation at any time and could give me resources or recomendations for getting as fast as possible up and running with the .NET environment.

Thanks!
stories.title: Ask HN: What is the fastest way to get hands-on with .NET from Java?
Gauging the happiness benefit of US urban parks through Twitter
Gov.uk removed jQuery and saw some big performance improvements as a result

stories.text:
Can anyone recommend any high quality books/forums/blogs related to technology startups? (other than Paul Graham's) I am really new to this and am currently just working on an MVP and testing.

There is so much written online, but it is difficult to know what is evidence-based and what is guesswork. Forums are filled with "hustlers" and irc is practically dead for business discussion.

A book/blog giving a good overview of the processes and knowledge that a founder should be familiar with would be helpful.
stories.title: Any good startup books/forums/blogs?
